title: Lesson 01: Solidify the Foundation
summary: Establish safe habits, correct grip, ready position, and forward net-lunge mechanics.
goals: Master the correct forehand grip (shake-hands grip).
Learn the front-court lunge to prevent injury.

structure.title: Introduction & Warm-up (15 min)
items: Safety briefing: non-slip court shoes, check slippery spots, avoid collisions.
Joint mobilization: neck tilts and turns (avoid full circles), shoulder circles, wrist circles, hip and knee circles, ankle circles.
Jog around the court or skip in place (2-3 minutes).

structure.title: Fundamental Technique: Grip & Stance (25 min)
items: Forehand grip: hold the racket shaft with the non-racket hand, shake hands with the handle, V-shape between thumb and index finger.
Checkpoints: feel the bevels, leave a gap between palm and handle.
Ready position: feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent, racket up in front of the chest, weight on the balls of the feet.

structure.title: Ball Confidence & Coordination (20 min)
items: Shuttle taps: keep the shuttle in the air with a forehand grip, aiming for eye level.
Pickup challenge: lift the shuttle from the floor with the racket.
Simple underhand feed: step in and gently lift the shuttle over the net.

structure.title: Footwork Basics: The Lunge (20 min)
items: Step forward with the racket leg.
Heel lands first, then roll to toe.
Key: front heel plants firmly to protect the knee.
Non-racket foot drags lightly as a brake.

structure.title: Fun Game: Bucket Challenge (10 min)
items: Place a box or bucket near the service line.
Use an underhand serve or toss to land the shuttle in the bucket.
Focus on touch and control, not power.

structure.title: Stretching & Debrief (10 min)
items: Recap: a wrong grip makes everything harder.
Homework: practice switching between a relaxed grip and the shake-hands grip.

drills.name: Shuttle taps
notes: Keep the shuttle at eye level.

coachingNotes: Reinforce the V-shape grip and the gap between palm and handle.
Keep the ready position relaxed but alert.
Front heel plants firmly during the lunge to protect the knee.
safety: Wear non-slip court shoes and check for slippery spots.
Avoid full neck rotations during warm-up.
Keep the knee aligned over the toes during lunges.
